name: FlatOut 2™
description: DRIVING THIS RECKLESS IS NO ACCIDENT! But you might want to cause a few. In these high-speed races, the more damage you inflict, the better. The ultimate in turbo-charged cars and the craziest competitor drivers are waiting to test your best destructive streak. Responsible drivers need not apply.
minimum_requirements: Windows XP/2000 XP SP2 / 2000 SP4, 256 MB RAM, 64 MB* video card, 2.0 GHz Pentium® 4 or AMD® 2000+ processor, DirectX compatible sound card, 3.5 GB free hard drive space, DirectX 9.0c, TCP/IP required for LAN play, 512kbs minimum, Broadband connection required FlatOut 2 supports gamepads. Gamepad with 8 buttons minimum (to support all configurable game commands) is recommended. * FlatOut 2 supports the following Chipsets, nVidia Geforce FX 5/6/7 series, ATI Radeon 9600 Pro/XT and above, ATI Radeon X200 and above. On-board/ integrated graphics cards and laptops not supported.

Big improvement over the first game. Strength of the cars is much higher, so the driving becomes much faster because you don't need to worry about blowing your car up after a few hits. Actually you can really feel the speed. Hits are also much more satisfying because of the star awards for every hit. Driver characters in every race also makes it more personal - if someone pushes you out of track or something, you can hunt him down afterwards, because every driver is different. In first game everyone was practically the same. There is also much more derby events, speedway races and stadium challanges, though i didn't like the show cars with the jet engines.  Overall a fun game where even just driving feels enjoyable. Score - 8/10

Flatout 2 is easily my favorite racing game of all time. It focuses on fun and enjoyment rather than wasting time with realism. The physics are funny, the soundtrack is great (if you like semi-modern rock music), The damage engine is good, The graphics aren't too outdated, and best of all, the driving feels great, even on a mouse and keyboard. My one dislike is that the menus have no mouse navigation, which is the only thing that makes me realize that it's a PC port.  I highly reccomend this game to anyone, really. If you're a fan of silly physics, damage engines, and good racing, you will adore this game.

To begin with, it's built on the same engine from the original flatout with addional post-effects thrown on top of it. And those are not good post effects, but some cheap brownish-orange overblurred sepia, like in GRID. They took the first game, increased the speed and added explosions, basically, they made a BurnOut out of the good game. Honestly, I tried. I finished the first tier for all golds, and on the second tier I realized it's overly boring. The original FlatOut was way more catchy and it was unique at the time. FO2 is on the other hand just a copycat of other popular arcade race games.

Flatout 2, in my opinion, is one of the best arcade raceing games you can find and I'm not just saying that because of the nostalgia I have for playing it on Playstation2.  Pros: +Graphics: For a game that came out in 2006 on the Playstation 2, it looks amazing. I would even say it's Playstation 3 good.  +Gameplay: The controls are simple but fun and there's plenty of gamemodes to make the price well worth it, from career mode to single races, minigames to demolition. The tracks are filled with hundreds of collidable and destructable objects to smash through, windows, furniture, billboards, fences, barn walls, ECT. The minigames are one of the best parts of the game, how can you not love hurling your drivers ragdoll body into a dart board or row of bowling pins?  +Very little glitches: Ignore the hours Steam says that i have played because I've spend a good few dozen hours back on the PS2 and I hardly run into any glitches. Really the only ones I seem to find is the rare object floating or getting stuck in your car for a few seconds, nothing gamebreaking.  +Soundtrack: The choice of music in Flatout 2 is amazing and I would dare say comparable to the older Tony Hawk games. Some of the bands featured in the game are Bad Religion, Megadeth, Yellowcard, Fallout Boy and Nickleback.  Cons: - Controller support: Although you can use an Xbox 360 controller, it's only partially compadable, but to be honest I don't find it to be that big of a deal, just a bit annoying. You can't pause with the controller or navigate the menus, because controllers only work when racing.  -No online support: Don't get this game if you're looking for a racing game to play with friend online, because it's a a port of a Playstation 2 game.  -Sofia Martinez: ♥♥♥♥ that ♥♥♥♥♥! She's always right behind you and the smallest mistake can have her to pass you up.

The game is great. This game has a lot of tracks to race on, and a lot of fun obstacles to fight through with your opponents! It's not only racing, there are also special games modes, for example, you have to jump out of a fast moving car and try to go the highest. This makes the game more fun.  The physics in the game are OK, it feels realistic to drive the cars, and ramming your opponents look awesome! But, be careful when driving fast, because even the tiniest objects, like sticks and rocks, can just bring your car to a wheelie and then crash, allowing your opponents to pass you.  There are a variety of cars to choose from, within 3 categories; derby, race and street. The cars are upgradable which is cool, but you cannot customize your car. The soundtrack for this game is epic! There are amazing tracks featuring Alkaline Trio and Yellow card etc. I think you'll enjoy the music, and old, classic racing game soundtracks sound great.  You might not like this game if you just want to race, because in this game, you will need to crash other cars as well, to get nitrous.  I really enjoy this game! And it's at a cheap price, so even better! This game is so recommended for fans of Burnout, like myself, and other car-crash and other action games.
